name: powderfinger
text: If you don't sizzle the meat, your guests will think you a bad host.

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, kenthegod, LordPretzel, gorrioncita)

name: i_love_kate
text: What?

name: scorpio_nadir
text: How can you get any PUDDING if you don't fivvle the meat?

name: wazza
text:
if you don't beat your meat, you can't have any pudding...

I challenge you to listen to this song and not hear these words now

name: petitegitan
text: The amount of sizzle is equal to the amount of deliciousness.

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by pityparty, NDCaesar, TheGreatestCape, achilleselbow, danielaroo, aperson)

name: zaratustra
text: It's a long s (%u017F).

name: zaratustra
text: that did not go well.

name: dusty
text: did you not realize the beautiful irony of what you have done?

name: charchar
text: It's basically an anglicised eszett . (It does make a sibilance, and I don't trust Assetbar with this sort of thing)

name: nosearmy
text:
After reading the article I think you are mistaken. es-zett is a long s combined with a z, hence the name. A long S is just that, a Long S .

I'm sorry about this.

name: charchar
text:
You're right: i didn't know that "long S" had its won character.

Its character is a sneaky one, though, sneaking in before H where it has no business being . Unless it's in IPA, in which case it goes 'sh' (Quoth the article, "voiceless postalveolar fricative")

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Sibilants. like...Spinal Tap?

name: soticoto
text: ... Wouldn't that be a Greek letter Beta?

name: ravindra108
text: No.

name: achilleselbow
text: A comment left by achilleselbow was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, johnnybaverage, daidai, goocifer, antecen, fancypants, wishlish, Njury, ravindra108, holly_golightly, Panserbjorne, I_Love_Kate, Captain_Arlo)

name: i_love_kate
text: Lamed for lack of ability to comprehend irony.

name: achilleselbow
text: Man I was a dick back then.

name: theguitarhero
text: back then?

name: zem
text: a burn nine months in the making

name: patkun
text: A comment left by patkun was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, kylank, ohmygooses)

name: rotating-dog
text: Three years later I can still quote the sixth panel verbatim. Is SO good.

name: zefiel
text: Does that help any when cooking

name: rotating-dog
text: I was worried about the sizzle, but it muft.

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pseudochron, fosters, Nasir, ravindra108)

name: phoenixultima
text: You know I think I'd actually buy the cookbook written by Lisa Popeil. I can't offer any rational explanation for this.

name: boheeka
text: lisa popeil is actually pretty cool. She used to tour with the zappa band in the eighties and she was a superb vocalist.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: The title of her book, "but wait, there's more!" is pretty dang clever, actually.

name: sp1derbaby
text: I had to Google "Popeil" but now I get it.

name: theloneliestmonkey
text: A comment left by theloneliestmonkey was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Thorfinn, Sargasm, michellemarie, jmmfgd)

name: lateadopter
text: I think it's one of the pieces of Onstad's real life that leaks into the strip.  "Write what you know."

name: soticoto
text: In the biblical sense?

name: werthog42
text:
I don't get it.
:(

name: stuart
text: Jamie Lee Curtis is married to Christopher Guest.

name: rowboat
text: I want to admit that I didn't get Cooking for Guests at first. But I also want to say that it occured to me just before it was actually spelled out here, and I think that's important. To me.

name: autrepoupee
text:
being a fan of both of these people i find it shocking that i only find out about their wedded bliss while reading the comment section of an internet comic about cats


what have i dooooone

name: zem
text: Oh My God Your Avatar

name: autrepoupee
text: oh this old thing i just grabbed it out of the closet ***giigles***

name: zem
text: i think you changed it since then and now my comment doesn't make any sense!

name: zem
text: i think you changed it since then and now my comment doesn't make any sense!

name: autrepoupee
text:
well look who it is

if it isn't the one who calls himself "Zem"

the guy with the angry beatnik avatar who had an Opinion about my old avatar of the bird smoking and saying 'Internet'

how are you doing?
has the evening found you well?

name: zem
text: can you post that image again?? i want to remember what i was talking about

name: autrepoupee
text:
buckle up because the driver of the mission is a pro
The Ruler's Back

name: zem
text: off we go, let the trumpets blow

name: lucid
text: I chubbied the exchange either way. The pink duck is a pretty fabulous avatar, so it didn't seem out of line.

name: stuart
text: now it's Baraka and it makes sense again

name: gouldgonewild
text: ...I thought it was a porygon

name: terriblerobot
text:
It is.

Why do I still know all the names of those infernal creatures!?

name: laserblade
text: my sentiments exactly

name: shutup_shutup
text: This sort of comment pretty well sums up the internet age.

name: ttagxamm
text: By design, I think. It strikes me as a satirical poke at this sort of celebrity publishing. cf. Teodor's vanity record collection.

name: lolsworth
text: The best jokes are the ones you don't realise are jokes for approximately 30 seconds

name: ezcmac
text:
The classic "f"-looking "s" absolutely made this comic.

The Bill of Rights always gets me, all looking like it says "Congrefs" at the top.

name: deancain29
text: Sizzle the Meat, it must sizzle. It must!

name: connellingus
text: I wouldn't really call Jamie Lee Curtis a celebrity wife. I think she's more famous than her husband.

name: saru
text:
She is a celebrity, and she is a wife.
I say she has more claim to the title than the rest of the motley lot, what do you say to that?

name: sp1derbaby
text: I say "Chubby."

name: gormster
text: Marth Washington would not have used a long s in her name. It is poor grammar.

name: zem
text:
is this true

i've always been curious about the long s's

name: shutup_shutup
text: In the very strange event that she was writing her name in the International Phonetic Alphabet she would have used that character.  She wouldn't have used an "h" though.  Also some other differences.

name: sargasm
text: You know, Mrs. Washington's steak recipe is basically all you really need anyway.  She knows steak so well she even trimmed the unnecessary fat from the recipe.

name: dasilodavi
text: It must sizzle.

name: spinynorman
text: I square love this strip.

name: anathan
text: You mean you love it squarely.

name: nikopol
text: Martha Washington was the 'Mommie Dearest' of Colonial-era cookbook authors.

name: xiaomimi
text: Speaking of old timey cookbooks, check [url="http://web.archive.org/web/20060909044306/http://staff-www.uni-marburg.de/~gloning/bookecok.htm"]this one[/url] out!  It's from the 16th century.  I keep meaning to make things from it but it's actually pretty hard to find one recipe that has a fully comprehensible and purchasable list of ingredients.

name: kelsotimebomb
text: No kidding.  Old recipes are basically impossible.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
That explains why there was so much gout then, and also why alot of species are extinct now.

Capons stewed, or in whyte broath.
A pestle of veneson upon a browes.
A chyne of beyfe and a breste of mutton
boylde. etc,etc.

name: frozendevil
text: Oh man, long s's are where it's at. This just made all sorts of my day.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Monday Blogs

Philippe: Boston!

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: Fantasies are Ridiculous.
Teodor: Brew Company Update
Lyle: FTP
Onstad: Boston, this one's for you
Little Nephew: Where I been, y'all?

name: achilleselbow
text: When your husband has wooden teeth, I don't suppose your recipes need to be very complex.

name: woodenteeth
text: ... we just yearn for an apple.

name: charchar
text: Bit O' Knowledge : George had to proofread all of Martha's letters, as she was a terrible speller. (She spelled 'cat' with two t s).

name: tekende
text: To be fair, most people back then couldn't read, let alone spell very well.

name: evilbobikus
text: 5 for having a Popeil cookbook.

name: tbtabby
text: I don't know about steak, but according to Uncle John's Bathroom Reader, Martha made a good whiskey cake.

name: tbtabby
text: And according to Uncle John's Bathroom Reader, she had a killer recipe for rum punch: 3 oz. white rum, 3 oz. dark rum, 3 oz. curacao, 4. oz. simple syrup, 4 oz. lemon juice, 4 oz. fresh orange juice, 3 lemons (quartered), 1/2 tsp. ground nutmeg, 3 cinnamon sticks (broken), 6 cloves, and 12 oz. boiling water. Yum.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Unfatisfactory?

name: tbtabby
text:
Science has made a startling discovery:

Martha Washington was HOT.

name: karljw
text: why is shigeru miyamoto telling me this?

name: dybrar
text: He really felt you ought to know.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i spent more time looking at the links that people posted than i did the comic, or even the comments themselves.  you guys are the shit.
